question: ナポレオン三世
sourceMnemonic: Adding "third generation" to someone's name means that they are the third generation of people with that name. In this case, the person's name is <ja>ナポレオン</ja> (Napoleon), so this means <vocabulary>Napoleon The Third</vocabulary>, also written as <vocabulary>Napoleon III</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The kanji here are pronounced exactly the same as in the standalone word <ja>三世</ja>. That is, it's a jukugo word which uses the on'yomi for both kanji.
